subject: Re: [junit] Beyond JUnit - talk at JavaOne
msgSnippet: ... Hi Alberto, I m planning to attend your session.  In fact, it may be the only JavaOne session I attend as I ll be spending most of my time across the
messageBody:
On Jun 21, 2004, at 11:00 AM, albsavoia wrote:

>
> Fellow JUnit users/fan, I am going to be giving a talk at JavaOne
> (next week in SF) on the future of unit/developer testing for Java.
>
> I was fortunate enough to spend some time with Kent Beck while
> preparing it, and he actually gave me material and suggestions for
> some of the slides and concepts.
>
> Unfortunately, I got stuck with a very tough time slot (afternoon of
> the last day of the conference) and I don't know how many people
> will manage to stick around after 4 days of Java tech talks :-).
>
> So, if you are attending JavaOne, or have friends/colleagues
> attending, please try to show up so we can let the JavaOne
> organizers that there is enough interest in developer/unit testing
> and JUnit to give this kind of topic better time slots in the future.
>
> Below is the time information and the abstract on the talk.
>
> I hope to see you there.

Hi Alberto,

I'm planning to attend your session. In fact, it may be the only
JavaOne session I attend as I'll be spending most of my time across the
street at WWDC. :-)

Mike
